results.title: Wonders of the universe [Volume 4]
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Wonders of the universe”.
Episode one of these three episodes, “Light fantastic” explores the realm of galaxies beyond the Milky Way and explains how modern astronomy has unveiled the wonders of a universe of interdependence where galaxies, clusters and super-clusters collide, entwine and unravel one another. “The Blue Planet” explores how Earth might appear to alien travellers from another world. How the sun drives our weather, why the tilt of the Earth causes the seasons, and what causes the variations in the length of day and night. “Big Bang big mystery” looks at the story of cosmology’s most popular creation theory : the notion that everything started in a cataclysmic eruption.

results.title: Wonders of the universe [Volume 1]
results.creator_credit: Terence Murtagh and York Films of England
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Wonders of the universe”.
The first episode “Cosmic catastrophes” explores the impact cosmic collisions have had on shaping our earth and the rest of the galaxy, describing the extent of the damage that even a relatively small piece of ‘spacejunk’ can have on life on Earth, and the surprising regularity with which collisions occur. Examines dwarf and giant stars, novas and supernovas, pulsars, black holes, shooting stars and comets. (25 mins) Episode two, “Home star”, looks at the birth, life and death of the nearest star to Earth, the Sun and describes how the universe is shaped by the influence of the Sun’s light and heat. (25 mins) Episode three, “Moonflight”, takes a tour of the most exotic moons in the solar system, including Earth’s only natural satellite, covers an in-depth exploration of the surface and features of the moon. (25 mins) Episode four, “Alone in space?”, is an investigation of the possibility that there are other life forms and forms of life in the universe - what is life and where did it begin? Looks at the use of Radio Astronomy in trying to detect life on other planets. (25 mins)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terence Murtagh and York Films of England

results.title: Women of the sun (A)
results.creator_credit: Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films
results.brief_description: A series of four dramas each of which focuses on the story of one Aboriginal woman at different stages of the history of white Australia, to illustrate some of the injustices which have been inflicted on the Aboriginals in the past.

results.title: Lo-Arna 1981
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Nottage, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Women of the sun (A)”.
Part Four of the “Women of the Sun” series which presents events that occurred to four different aboriginal women, at different periods in time. This episode is set in 1981 and examines the inner turmoil and insecurity of an 18 year old girl when her adoptive parents tell her she is not of French Polynesian descent, but is the daughter of an Aboriginal woman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Nottage, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films

results.title: Nerida Anderson, 1939
results.creator_credit: Stephen Wallace, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Women of the sun (A)”.
Part Three of a series which presents events that occurred to four different aboriginal women at different periods in time. Set in 1939, this episode examines attempts by Nerida Anderson and her family to improve conditions on the Aboriginal Reserve where they live. Such attempts and displays of independence outrage the manager. He has Nerida and her family tried for treason. Realising a no-win situation, the entire population of the reserve pack their belongings and leave.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Wallace, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films

results.title: Maydina the shadow 1890's
results.creator_credit: David Stevens, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Women of the sun (A)”.
Part Two of a series which presents events that occurred to four different aboriginal women at different periods in time. This episode examines the life of Maydina and her half-caste daughter on a church mission run by a self-appointed guardian at the turn of the century. Follows her struggle to return to a tribal existence and her efforts to prevent her daughter being taken away from her by the mission guardian.

results.title: Women in the Eighties
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: United we sit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Women in the Eighties”.
Helen Monaghan, shop steward in a Scottish jeans factory, tells how 240 women organised a seven month sit-in to fight for their jobs, and won.

results.title: Full circle
results.creator_credit: Donna Read and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Women and spirituality”.
This is a stirring documentary that awakens memories of ancestral roots that connect us to each other and to all living things. It is a journey that looks at some of the manifestations of the modern women’s spirituality movement in the western world. Through contmporary spirituality, whether from Wicca, pagan or indigenous peoples we see people communing with each other or alone. Rituals become gateways that lead to an inner place where twentieth century notions of domination over the earth are replaced with a sense of awe.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donna Read and National Film Board of Canada
